title: Connect a two-sided test to a confidence interval

content.prompt: In a test of H0: μ = 8 versus Ha: μ ≠ 8, a sample of size of 220 leads to a p-value of 0.034. Which of the following must be true?

choices.label: A 95% confidence interval for μ calculated from these data will not include μ = 8.
At the 5% level if H0 is rejected, the probability of a Type II error is 0.034.
The 95% confidence interval for μ calculated from these data will be centered at μ = 8.
The null hypothesis should not be rejected at the 5% level.
The sample size is insufficient to draw a conclusion with 95% confidence.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Justify a claim based on a confidence interval.
